name: Gholam-Hosein Saedi in  Père Lachaise cemetery, Paris, France.
description:
Me before quarantine.

Gholam-Hossein Saedi MD was a prolific Iranian writer. He published over forty books, representing his talents in the fiction genres of drama, the novel, the screenplay, and the short story in addition to the non-fiction genres of cultural criticism, travel literature and ethnography.
He died in Paris in 1985 and was buried in Perlashes Cemetery.
